{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3364379,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T17:37:38.078Z","cooked":"

I am trying to sync up the TalonFX with the Rev Through Bore Encoder (so if the encoder gets broken we will not mess up a match). The problem is that setPosition seems to be doing absolutely nothing. I set the SensorToMechanism variable but the setPosition does not seem to be putting in the required offset. Is there anyone who has experienced a similar issue? Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T17:37:38.078Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":333,"reads":250,"readers_count":249,"score":1715.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/rev-through-bore-encoders-for-falcon-position-closed-loop/461214/6","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"REV Through Bore Encoders for Falcon Position Closed Loop","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/1","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3364404,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T18:09:52.934Z","cooked":"

Yes. Need code to begin to help you.

Sorry! (note: rotor offset “works” but it will not work in a geared scenario as it only does offset within one rotation)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T18:21:41.863Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":88.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Elijah Beard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/7/97655ae181726dc58e42a429f14a6db15b905dec.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor"},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/3","custom_user_title":"5402 Programming M̶e̶n̶t̶o̶r̶ Advisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364429,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T18:48:11.369Z","cooked":"

That code is calling setPosition() before setting the invert, which will result in unexpected behavior since invert also affects the reported Talon FX position. Make sure all configs are applied before calling setPosition().

Additionally, in Phoenix 6, invert is a config (as is neutral mode), so it should be applied with the other configs. You can set the motor to be inverted using config.MotorOutput.Inverted = InvertedValue.Clockwise_Positive;.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T18:48:11.369Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":50.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56380,"username":"ebear11","name":"Elijah Beard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/4","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364431,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T18:49:40.722Z","cooked":"

Would it also be smart to set a rotor to mechanism offset instead of using set position?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T18:49:40.722Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48146,"username":"bhall-ctre","name":"Benjamin Hall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364433,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T18:54:41.257Z","cooked":"

The only offset config the Talon FX supports is the FeedbackRotorOffset, which adjusts the rotor position (before the SensorToMechanismRatio) within one rotation. So if a SensorToMechanismRatio is used (which it looks like it would be here), setPosition() is the correct API to use.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T18:54:41.257Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":50.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51496,"username":"woodworker2001","name":"Dan Langdon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/6","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364434,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T18:56:00.543Z","cooked":"

That makes sense. Thanks for clarification on what that call does!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T18:56:00.543Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48146,"username":"bhall-ctre","name":"Benjamin Hall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364442,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T19:07:35.752Z","cooked":"

All of this assumes your feedbackConfigs.SensorToMechanismRatio is correct. You didn’t let us check that for you. I’d assume a small number like 0.01 for 1 encoder turn for 100 motor turns. If you do units conversion, too, you might have a 1 encoder turn for 36000 motor degrees (1/36000).
edit sorry replied wrong. to @ebear11

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T19:10:18.742Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51496,"username":"woodworker2001","name":"Dan Langdon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364498,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-17T20:32:45.632Z","cooked":"
SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

I’d assume a small number like 0.01 for 1 encoder turn for 100 motor turns

The SensorToMechanismRatio should be >1 for a reduction. If you have a 100:1 gear ratio between the motor and the encoder, then you would set the SensorToMechanismRatio to 100.

We also do not recommend using the SensorToMechanismRatio for general unit conversions, as certain conversions can cause the position and velocity values to overflow beyond the ranges documented in getPosition() and getVelocity(). Rotations are already convenient to work with and are easily converted to radians and degrees in user code.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-17T20:34:19.250Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/9","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364658,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T00:19:18.106Z","cooked":"

Trying not to hijack the OP thread…. We had an issue with setPosition() where it wasn’t taking the exact position we were assigning it. We had a sensor to mech ratio of 270:1 and it would Assign the position off by a slightly different amount but that equated to around .2 degrees of output.
We could put the number we were setting the position with in the smart dashboard and the position and they were off. Never by the exact same amount but around .0006 of a revolution. Does this have to do with the error you are talking about?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T00:19:18.106Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":463158,"topic_slug":"setposition-not-working","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48146,"username":"bhall-ctre","name":"Benjamin Hall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/setposition-not-working/463158/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3364954,"name":"Elijah Beard","username":"ebear11","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T13:05:40.923Z","cooked":"

I moved to a test bench to make sure the gearing was not the issue. The code I sent was for the testbench. Even with a 1:1 it does not go to the same spot every power reboot. (which means it is not taking the encoder position into account)

I tried it without the invert as well to be sure that was not the issue. it had the same effect.

Try giving a timeout argument to setPosition() of 1.0 (seconds). We were having the same problem, I think this is what made our offset consistent finally.

We ran into an issue where the throughbore encoder was not reading correctly as soon as robot was powered on. Our solution was to start a new thread and delay the setting of the position for 2 seconds.

new Thread(() -> {
      try {
        Thread.sleep(2500);

// this is the method that runs setPosition()
        ShooterRotationSubsystem.setShooterAngleMotorSensorPos();

      } catch (Exception e) {

      }
    }).start();

That did not work. HOWEVER, I was able to solve the issue. I moved the setPosition function out of the constructor into the goToSetpoint function and added logic to check if it was synced and whatnot. That solved my issue entirely. However, I also do not know why it solved my issue. I still have to test it on the actual robot itself now. Edit: It worked on our main robot. I repeatedly called the setPosition code when the robot was disabled to ensure it got the position. Test Bench Code for anyone wondering:

solution878×526 30.3 KB

A note for posterity: we saw a similar issue trying to synchronize a talon rotor with an absolute duty cycle encoder, and in our case the problem actually turned out to be weirdness in reading the duty cycle, rather than weirdness with the CTRE code. The initial duty cycle readings seemed to be something like 1.5% lower than the later readings.

We “solved” it in one of the ways mentioned above: spawn a thread to wait a few seconds and then do the synchronization.
